EE68D934BEF44E7EBE00BFD69C77B71F.description: Document and reflect on implementation (e.g., What did I do well? What will I do differently next time? Did I effectively communicate my action?).

19F5AABA81D34AF4B75C543CD438F92E.description: Design and follow a brief outline of a plan, including a schedule.

2142014B77ED47FFAECADCE2ED88B563.description: Identify basic steps to design and carry out effective action plans (i.e., who, what, where, when, why, how).

A6BE4F33EDAA48FDA233BEBC77B4501B.description: Design and apply, with guidance, two four-day action plans that require communication related to healthy eating and physical activity, prevention/ management of health challenges, negotiating disagreements, safety and protection, personal identity, and stressors.

9770B7C4566642E39679723E2DB186E9.description: Apply decisions that will improve personal health and/or the health of others.

5CCFCF841BD64508951383A848F022E5.description: Evaluate the importance of silence and reflection when making informed decisions.

DEB08865C37D4BF39C96534E0F08F9D5.description: Compare examples that demonstrate personal responsibility and those that do not.

3B1814D23BBC41B09CF5ADCC11AE0DBC.description: Illustrate how informed decision making is influenced by personal responsibility.

4E47FF8022B94B96893D8EE20DDD3BC4.description: Link personal health behaviours to potential health outcomes (e.g., inactivity and diabetes).

A254D27C478A40ADB5D3421F1543F80A.description: Identify opportunities to demonstrate personal responsibility when making decisions.

E6913E2EC25A4F22A1446437F9128BE7.description: Investigate factors that have the greatest influence on personal responsibility.

38E848E3B98A4B9BB4A56F70D314816B.description: Consider the purpose and consequences of communication in making decisions.

1F85AC669B3D401BA0EEEABD8BD026D6.description: Review factors that affect one’s communication and personal responsibility when making decisions (e.g., sharing of limited resources).

F14A51E12D5E4DF7977307035517A59D.description: Investigate the importance of personal responsibility and communication in making informed decisions related to healthy eating and physical activity, prevention/ management of health challenges, negotiating disagreements, safety and protection, personal identity, and stressors

01B46861C57F4FE2B735F948AC3B7269.description: Make informed decisions based on health-related knowledge.

4F8D7E8A2D05482F9673804B08CB219A.description: Describe strategies (e.g., writing in a journal, seeking guidance from a trusted adult/elder, talking with a friend, participating in cultural ceremonies, reading a book about grief) for managing stress (including divorce, death, and loss).

979765378F3442AEB59910EBC36D5DA4.description: Examine and discuss media portrayals of stressors such as divorce, death, and loss, and media portrayals of stress management strategies.

7FF83F5785E445D4B60B530266443757.description: Analyze common coping strategies for managing stress.

47ACB058749949A383A5BD11193867F1.description: Recognize potentially stressful situations and examine possible reactions to the experience.

C6CC3871FEFC4021B41EA36C297330F0.description: Determine how and why people react differently to stress (e.g., cultural traditions, role models).

593E0058BFA047E281BFC5CD8C8093B5.description: Explore the responses one may experience as a result of stress (e.g., heart-rate increase, blushing, knots in stomach, butterflies in stomach, dry mouth, sleeplessness, loss of concentration).

9C81096E76554A24997F938FE56CABCF.description: Communicate an informed personal understanding of stress (e.g., reaction of worry and/or pre-occupation).

8589F7781C2D449E84A4F0BE18F3BF47.description: Develop and use respectful language to talk about stress (e.g., grief, loss, fear, expectations) and to describe the intensity of feelings (e.g., rating scale/thermometer of 1-10).

C9D2CBA257334404A93ACB5C14058D6C.description: Assess healthy stress management strategies (e.g., relaxation skills, stress control skills, guided imagery, expressing feelings, exercising).

95C7C7C6CB9A481CB5A88931FC57B99E.description: Demonstrate an awareness of the influence on self when connecting with others who behave appropriately/inappropriately and/or legally/illegally (e.g., alcohol and tobacco use by minors).

666FB5630085426BB96ADE92E042A8F1.description: Describe examples of positive and negative peer influence on self-concept, self-esteem, and self-determination (e.g., feeling inadequate, confident/overconfident, fearful/fearless, limiting/ reaching one’s potential).

B3872DA396594D149AB20979ACBBAE11.description: Describe how self-concept is influenced by personal thoughts, self-esteem by personal feelings, and sense of self-determination by personal actions.

3FBBA35189D14069BF3FCA393A6CAC33.description: Determine factors (e.g., personal attitudes, supportive environments, accomplishments, positive thinking, media stereotyping, culture, gender) that may influence one’s identity.

A7D175B419AE4C619E7EC7C98B236F89.description: Communicate a personal understanding of identity.

A6F2B810D6DF4DBD8E4FBE89CC37E7A7.description: Examine “identity” as being related to how one “feels” on the inside and how one chooses to define self in relation to personal qualities, characteristics, and cultural definitions.

CB823161A05D4EB6831EE879B77CF172.description: Investigate information and definitions of self-concept (i.e., thoughts one has about self), self-esteem (i.e., a feeling of pride in self), and self-determination (i.e., right to make own choices) to develop an understanding of identity.

C9269FDCC5D94FFFA729CAE9FBBD9761.description: Observe and investigate ways that others define and value self, and learn ways to help others know one more fully and positively (e.g., ask questions, share stories, offer to help).

F99FD00399294F388F1E233267221E56.description: Examine how identity (i.e., self-concept, selfesteem, self-determination) is influenced by relationships that are formed with others.

BD15081584DB4742A929B4A67FF66CEB.description: Examine one’s responsibility to use electronic networks in an ethical and safe manner.

11AE7CE4CFDA4A88A3F2C261F4DEFEAC.description: Share expectations for personal safety and protection in various environments/situations.

CDEE3F122F5F495DB2976E207C147AEA.description: Distinguish behaviours that may jeopardize people’s safety and those that increase people’s safety in a variety of situations (e.g., ‘show-boating’ vs. being careful, not/wearing personal protective equipment, not/making and following a plan, not/asking permission).

AD5BD01B4F2C4481AD31191D6FC543AD.description: Review safety policies and/or plans (e.g., harassment, fire, tornado) for a variety of local environments (e.g., home, school, street).

58F4D67B504D4239881C9735C67488A8.description: Examine laws, behaviours, and community rules/regulations that are in place to minimize/prevent risks (e.g., smoke detectors, fire bans, life jackets, supervised computer use, non-smoking public places).

D827BBD8FC0049DF819BA0E9E1D555D8.description: Discuss various safety rules and practices related to community safety needs.

D3E8067E94FE42D3B54DA176E8D4AD50.description: Examine cyber safety etiquette and related safety risks and strategies.

0DE7A10C207B4565B19DF2ADCCA0E286.description: Investigate common personal and community activities/ environments to identify those that involve greater safety risks.

0877A590343245BEB66B9066E9B12913.description: Explore critical safety needs (e.g., cyber, hunting, water, fire, biking) of self and others in local community.

3FE2F84B6E26490B9D1110045231C7FF.description: Examine prior knowledge and new information related to safety (including cyber safety).

58AFF9D64FF74F5984101BBA3CBF62C2.description: Determine basic personal responsibility for safety and protection in various environments/situations.

17143773AD73409594222B278BF1F71E.description: Examine how honouring and respecting other points of view, beliefs, and/or values does not mean one has to abandon one’s own.

D7FCFE5B0BC3430D9F5E5537D5F87629.description: Investigate how effectively/ineffectively negotiated disagreements affect relationships.

2EAFCD45C6374F6FB21EA47F811096FE.description: Recognize and describe anger triggers for self and others (e.g., name calling, being reprimanded, broken promises).

23826B0923CE4848A40B213DEAD3A414.description: Recognize that disagreements are part of healthy and of unhealthy relationships.

8BBD6263F06046028A4369CD51443750.description: Represent what disagreements look like, sound like, and feel like.

4D260412B7EE446BBC8E6C3E02871E94.description: Practise the ability to calm self and discuss how it is important to remain calm in disagreements.

2A9AF89D54B544B6853118D0E95E3BFA.description: Reflect on personal behaviours that might influence others to feel included and those that may cause feelings of rejection.

C7244A2243514CF1906F1C7A8A4C6E3E.description: Determine healthy ways to relate to peers not in personal circle of friends (e.g., listen and ask questions, give compliments).

C6A38E2A35FF410383AC43F47966D7EB.description: Suggest alternatives when play is not enjoyable (e.g., join another play activity, negotiate changes to the play).

CCA9C67B3A6144E5BAA3B3799CF2C976.description: Recognize how various factors, including peer pressure, communication strategies, and assumptions affect relationships.

1849F05E3A124F89BBE077E7E0EC4646.description: Describe and recommend healthy behaviours, including positive communication skills for getting along with others in play and competitive situations (e.g., an appreciation of silence as an opportunity to reflect and refrain from “jumping in”, analyzing and criticizing ideas and not the people offering them).

C6984497F8A9461397CB60509AC4C458.description: Compare qualities of healthy and unhealthy relationships and determine the connections of these relationships to a healthy mind, body, and spirit.

694474AAD52D48509F7200A907E3CA75.description: Examine healthy interpersonal skills and determine strategies to effectively develop new relationships and/or negotiate disagreements in relationships.

5B5FCEA841EE4B76ABF69034EF2F85E7.description: Examine strategies to reduce the prevalence and the impact of potential current health challenges (e.g., immunity to antibiotics, pandemics, obesity, HIV/AIDS).

EA2BD9F959CE444AB041D49C087AAD2D.description: Investigate the changes in practices (e.g., use of new plants in medications to replace those no longer available, use of technology) to prevent or manage health challenges

D794F3FAFF794D0193D475BF38F10794.description: Examine basic costs to society when threats to health (i.e., mind, body, and spirit) are not prevented/managed.

64B011DDB9B64CC38E1CB964A1B84D30.description: Examine historical (including First Nations and Métis healing practices), contemporary (including technological), and complementary practices (e.g., inclusion of healing circles and sweat lodges along with counselling in the treatment of mental illness) for preventing/managing health challenges (including mental health/illness, HIV/AIDS, Hepatitis C, diabetes).

53FD3416F0544212934698F4276C1758.description: Explain how the mind, body, and spirit may be affected by health challenges (e.g., irritability, fatigue, motivation, depression).

B455F4EBFC0D4E0EAC1DCB5C6259329C.description: Categorize and compare a variety of health challenges as shortterm/long-term (e.g., depression) and as serious/not serious (e.g., HIV/AIDS).

0C122C0E2D7D4CF9A2D007319D1CAB52.description: Investigate and distinguish points of view expressed about health opportunities and challenges, both past and present (e.g., management of illness/disease, tobacco legislation, obesity).

D835273BEE734107853F8826403597A9.description: Illustrate how both traditional healing (including First Nations and Métis practices) and current Western medical advances have influenced the prevention and/or management of past and present health challenges (including mental health/ illness, HIV/AIDS, Hepatitis C, diabetes).

12DCAAFCF6C84392AA5333B9CEDEC596.description: Investigate personal changes that need to be made for better nutrition (e.g., serving sizes, variety of foods) and appropriate amounts of physical activity (see Canada’s Guide to Physical Activity).

54F347AD4ECC4704A23D4BB889C628FD.description: Investigate the physical activity opportunities in the community that benefit and/or challenge mental, socio-emotional, and spiritual well-being for pre/adolescence (e.g., develop personal gifts, and potential).

5E39EAC99C0C40AB897385030D3EED30.description: Explore the consequences (both positive and negative) of following or resisting peer norms and/or popular trends related to eating and physical activity.

F2BE4202ED224A77B34165018E94AA16.description: Investigate peer norms and popular trends related to healthy eating and physical activity.

3DCD7FC7F89C45D88D117CEB7F3BEF75.description: Review the health benefits of regular physical activity and the health risks of inactivity for pre/adolescence.

843C6BA491FE4EC397CDB7DB8F318C61.description: Investigate personal, family, community, and cultural factors that influence physical activity (e.g., time, cultural practices and values, access, safety).

8F2DC7DC2DEC40B89E54DBDFB60C6667.description: Demonstrate an understanding of healthy food choices (e.g., analyze nutritional values of particular foods) and serving sizes that support good health (see Canada’s Food Guide).

476F6B2BF9854069BD00237DBD6CC290.description: Explain the importance of particular eating practices, including drinking water as a thirst quencher and eating breakfast.

E08F54E8F6FB4407926B5A7D0020214B.description: Discuss factors of healthy eating over which one has control (e.g., drinking more water).

D2BD3D181BE7459083DFE95F6F0007F4.description: Investigate personal, family, community, and cultural factors that influence healthy eating (e.g., time, serving size, cultural food practices and values, water consumption, access to healthy foods).

4144AA01ADE94F6E9B9B6A1BB6DBAEA3.description: Examine personal, past, and present knowledge about healthy eating and physical activity (e.g., exercise as important to health, trends such as jogging and home gyms, females and exercise/ sports)

D22D1086112F4DB28655593DEA62C4EB.description: Assess what healthy eating and physical activity mean for pre/adolescence.

4ECFF8F1EB8948C2A27E1099EFBC22B9.description: Develop the understanding, skills, and confidences necessary to take action to improve health.
